alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... None of this undercuts the status I believe modern science deservedly enjoys as the best way of increasing our understanding of the physical world. But our expectations will be more realistically grounded if we come to appreciate that science is as subject to extraneous influences — including the human ego — as is any other field of human endeavour, past or present."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Conduct of Scientific Inquiry is Often a Lot More Haphazard than we Tend to Think - Part 2
